report_title: Industry Report on Barbecue and Grill Manufacturing
executive_summary: Barbecue and grill producers have endured some volatility in recent years. Since individuals and households are the most common end-market for grills, demand for new products is closely tied to the health of the residential construction sector and other macroeconomic factors, like disposable income and consumer confidence. Domestic producers benefited from activity in residential real estate during the initial stages of the pandemic when near-zero interest rates led to jumps in the value of residential construction. Demand for the construction sector weakened because drastic interest rate hikes pushed long-term borrowing costs higher, contributing to falling grill sales. Similarly, elevated inflation in 2022 pushed consumers to postpone discretionary purchases like barbecues. However, losses during the period failed to reverse pandemic-related gains. As a result, revenue has grown at an estimated CAGR of 3.2% to $2.1 billion through 2024, including a 3.6% dip that year alone.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The health of the residential construction sector directly impacts sales
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Many consumers buy new grills and barbecues when residential construction rises. Consumers are more likely to purchase new appliances and large products when buying a new home, making sales reliant on the health of the residential real estate sector.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Other macroeconomic factors help determine discretionary sales
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Grills and barbecues are often considered discretionary purchases, with many consumers postponing buying new ones when macroeconomic conditions are unfavorable, including elevated inflation and weaker consumer confidence.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Improving Macroeconomic Conditions Create Growth Opportunities
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Improving macroeconomic conditions will give consumers more disposable income for discretionary purchases, particularly as inflationary pressures cool down and consumers can allocate more resources to buying luxury products.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: A Recovering Construction Sector Support New Grill Sales
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Macroeconomic conditions are set to improve over the coming years. Stabilizing macroeconomic factors, including falling inflation, weaker unemployment and lower mortgage rates, will enable residential construction activity to continue recovering, supporting rising demand for barbecues and grills.

industry_definition: This industry comprises establishments that manufacture barbecue and grilling equipment, including gas and solid-fuel barbecues, grills and braziers, in addition to parts and accessories. Other outdoor cooking equipment, such as outdoor stoves, are excluded from this industry.

positive_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level high - steady

key_trends: Imports satisfy more than 45.0% of domestic demand. This is largely because of lower wage costs and fewer regulations abroad, which enable foreign producers to offer lower prices and appeal to price-conscious buyers.

Offshoring to places like China and Mexico helps US producers offer competitive prices. However, despite fierce import competition, consumer preference for 'Made in USA' grills is driving growth domestically.

Demand for grills and barbecues is largely determined by the health of the residential construction space. Because of this, grill sales jumped during the initial stages of the pandemic, when residential construction was hot, and it weakened amid interest rate hikes in 2022.

As macroeconomic conditions improve, consumers will have more disposable income for discretionary products. Falling inflation and stabilizing steel prices will support revenue growth, although at a slower rate than in the past.

The industry is highly segmented. Producers cater to diverse consumer needs, with some companies focusing on premium products for high-end consumers, while others target price-sensitive buyers with low-cost options.
Manufacturers must continually innovate to stand out in a crowded market. Some have developed new cooking technologies, while others focus on more durable and long-lasting materials.

Producers are directly impacted by appliance prices. If grill prices go up, people become more likely to postpone discretionary purchases. However, efficient cost-passing by manufacturers can still lead to higher revenue despite fewer unit sales.
The CPSIA mandates strict safety testing for barbecue and grill products and accessories. This ensures consumer safety by reducing exposure to hazardous substances.
Rising operating costs and heightened price-based competition squeeze profit. Manufacturers allocate more resources toward labor while offering competitive prices, both of which reduce profit.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Retailers, including independent and brand-owned stores, are the largest downstream market for grill manufacturers. These stores serve downstream consumers directly, making them the crucial last step of the supply chain. By purchasing directly from the manufacturer, retailers can avoid the wholesale markup and buy grills and barbecues at a lower price. This has pushed manufacturers to increasingly focus on serving the retail sector.
Wholesalers supply businesses and large buyers, including universities, hotels and restaurants.
Other buyers include individual consumers, businesses for end use, repair shops and building contractors.

products_and_services.product_description: Gas grills are considered to be a middle point between others. Gas barbecues and grills are generally considered to be a compromise between charcoal and electric grills regarding convenience and flavor.
Charcoal cookers are typically thought to make better-tasting food compared with gas cookers.
Electric barbecues and grills can heat quickly and require less fuel than other fuel-based products.
Typically, portable grills are tough, lightweight burners powered by gas canisters.

tier_1_suppliers: Screw, Nut & Bolt Manufacturing in the US
Metal Stamping & Forging in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Iron Ore Mining in the US
Steel Rolling & Drawing in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: New housing construction is one of the largest factors determining the purchase of household appliances, including outdoor grills.
Retailers, including independent and brand-owned stores, are the largest downstream market for grill manufacturers.

international_trade_points.trade_title: China accounts for a smaller portion of imports
international_trade_points.trade_description: Chinese grills and barbecues continue to account for the largest portion of imports.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Countries with lower operating costs are popular grill producers
international_trade_points.trade_description: Foreign manufacturers pose a significant threat to domestic producers.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Exports weaken amid unfavorable macroeconomic conditions
international_trade_points.trade_description: Exports have been falling in recent years as heightened inflation globally has pushed consumers to lower discretionary purchases.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Domestic producers rely heavily on Canadian buyers
international_trade_points.trade_description: Domestic producers benefit from trade agreements that lower trade-related costs.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast holds a large population and is a manufacturing hub.
Steel production in the Great Lakes attracts grill manufacturers.
Strong barbecuing culture in the Southwest lures manufacturers to the region.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The Consumer Product Safety Improvement Act (CPSIA) sets strict safety guidelines for products.
The Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) sets emissions standards to control air quality.
Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) regulations impact the barbecue and grill production industry.

barriers_points.barrier_description: The industry is in a mature life cycle stage.
The industry assistance level is low and steady.
The globalization level is high and steady.

basis_points.basis_title: Imports satisfy more than 45.0% of domestic demand
basis_points.basis_description: Imports satisfy more than 45.0% of domestic demand.

basis_points.basis_title: Consumer preference for 'Made in USA' grills

concentration_points.concentration_title: Internal and External Competition Have Impacted Concentration

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Rising Operating Costs Push Profit Downward
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Grill producers' profitability has been negatively impacted by fluctuations in operating costs.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Rising Demand Drives Wage Expenses Higher
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Although manufacturers have been allocating more resources toward automating the production process.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchase Costs Fall Despite Rising Steel Prices
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Rising demand for manufactured products and severe supply chain disruptions push input price volatility.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Workers are needed for a broad range of tasks.

volatility_points.volatility_description: In times of economic uncertainty, people tend to become more cautious about their spending.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Smart Grilling Technologies Are Becoming More Popular
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: New grills include technology, allowing users to manage and monitor.

FAQs.question: How is your company affected by rising imports?
FAQs.answer: Imported grills pose a significant threat to domestic producers.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in a niche or do you produce a diversified range of products?
FAQs.answer: Some grill manufacturers specialize in certain types of grills to gain a reputation.
